    <h1 style="font-size: 3em; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;">Genomic Epidemiology of Salmonella Paratyphi B Isolates from Bangladesh</h1>
    <p style="font-size: 1.5em; text-align: center; max-width: 800px; margin: 0 auto;">Our research focuses on understanding the prevalence, genomic characteristics, and antimicrobial resistance of Salmonella Paratyphi B isolates in Bangladesh using Whole Genome Sequencing (WGS) and phylogenetic analysis.</p>

<!-- Structured Program Details Below the Image -->
  <h3 style="text-align: center; font-weight: bold;">Highlights</h3>
  <ul style="list-style-type: none; padding: 0;">
    <li>Salmonella Paratyphi B biotype Java detected in invasive cases.</li>
    <li>ST43/PG4 is the dominant lineage in Bangladesh.</li>
    <li>No antimicrobial resistance genes were found in the isolates studied.</li>
  </ul>

  <h3 style="text-align: center; font-weight: bold;">Background</h3>
  <p style="text-align: center;">Salmonella species are among the most common causes of foodborne diseases. Our research aims to better understand the genomic background of Salmonella Paratyphi B biotype Java, the most dominant in Bangladesh.</p>

  <h3 style="text-align: center; font-weight: bold;">Methods</h3>
  <ul style="list-style-type: none; padding: 0;">
    <li>1. Surveillance study conducted from 1999 to 2002 in major Bangladeshi hospitals.</li>
    <li>2. Cultures confirmed microbiologically, serologically, and biochemically.</li>
    <li>3. Whole Genome Sequencing (WGS) using Illumina Next Generation Sequencing platform.</li>
    <li>4. Multi-locus sequence typing (MLST) and phylogenetic analysis conducted using RAxML-NG.</li>
  </ul>

  <h3 style="text-align: center; font-weight: bold;">Results and Discussion</h3>
  <p style="text-align: center;">14 isolates of Salmonella Paratyphi B were identified in the study, of which 13 belonged to biotype Java. Phylogenetic analysis showed clustering with isolates from other countries, with no detected antimicrobial resistance genes. This clustering was most prominent in phylogenetic group ST43/PG4.</p>

  <h3 style="text-align: center; font-weight: bold;">Conclusion</h3>
  <p style="text-align: center;">Salmonella Paratyphi B biotype Java is the dominant serovar in Bangladesh. WGS analysis shows a low prevalence of antimicrobial resistance, underscoring the need for continued surveillance.</p>

<script>
  let slideIndex = 0;
  const slides = document.querySelectorAll('.mySlides');
  
  function showSlides() {
    slides.forEach((slide) => {
      slide.style.opacity = '0';  // Hide all slides
    });
    slideIndex++;
    if (slideIndex > slides.length) { slideIndex = 1; }  // Loop back to first slide
    slides[slideIndex - 1].style.opacity = '1';  // Show the current slide
    setTimeout(showSlides, 3000);  // Change image every 3 seconds
  }

  document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function() {
    showSlides();  // Initialize the slideshow
  });
</script>
